intro: Senecio hakeifolius var. adenophyllus, commonly known as the腺叶千里光, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, lance-shaped leaves with a hairy underside. The plant produces small yellow flowers arranged in composite heads, typical of the daisy family. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
